reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Ship: Remasted is a beautiful looking remake of a game with great gameplay mechanics.

This short video shows the game's current state, however ignore the point I made about the game lacking online multiplayer, because that has since been remedied. Although, it is limited to 4 players, which brings me to my first problem.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TssQgFAIIyU
The game at the moment of writing this review, is a bit limited. You can't add bots, and online play only allows for 4 players, so you can't really get the true The Ship experience unless you play LAN, which allows for 16 players.

With that said, the game itself is great. The graphics look gorgeous, and there are 4 diverse enough maps at the moment, with more to be released down the road.

I'm generally not a fan of Early Access, but the Devs are being transparent, and even have a roadmap on their website detailing features that have already been implemented, and some that are planned. This gives me a bit more faith. Also, this is a remake of a great game, so you know that the main gameplay mechanics will be good.

Speaking of which, all the things you need to actually play a real game of the Ship are implemented. There's a security system where you can get caught, as well as a system that shows you who your target is, and where they are. The only problem I have at the moment is just the fact that I can't easily play it until they allow for more players per online match, as I, like many others, don't have access to a 16 player LAN group.

The game needs quite a decent bit of optimization as well, as it doesn't run as well as it should be.

Despite some missing features, I'm going to be giving a positive recommendation due to the fact that the progress so far seems promising. The devs show that they are listening to consumers, as they chose to push back the release date once because of people that shared my concerns with the game's previous lack of features.

Their transparency with updates also gives me faith. Most importantly, the original The Ship was a great game, so they can only really build upon that great gameplay. If you don't feel comfortable buying the game in its current state, definitely support it in the coming weeks when they add even more features!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The original Ship, was easily on of my favorite games to date, in fact, I still play it quite a bit.

The Ship: Remasted, is a gorgeous remake of the ship, with improved mechanics, fixes with previous bugs, tweaked flaws in the original, and much more. If you've played the old one, you may have noticed that online playis kinda dead, but this one is a different story, theres still hope. But even offine with bots is really fun. The point is, if you don't own this game, I recommend it 110%, it'll change your life.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

What is The Ship:Remasted? Well it sertainly gave this game some life. I really enjoy rhis game. I did see some minor improvements just like they said they were going to be adding. Now I want to go over some Pros and Cons for this game I have experienced for playing this game the first time. Also I did play the original so I know. for this stage in early access here are some pros and cons.

Pros:
1 incredible Badass Graphics.
2 New minor updates that bring new life to the game
3 overall a lot of fun to play.

Cons:
1 Bugs and frame lag
2 Limited Features (Will get fixed soon)
3 Glitches with interface when playing the game
4 More Bugs
5 Sometimes when you die your screen goes completely black and it does not want you to exit the game

Anyway these are some of the pros and cons I got for the game at this current stage? So is it worth buying it at this stage? Well when you get it for a deal like I got it for 40% off and you can get it for 15% go ahead and do it. The game will improve and I can't wait to see what happens when it leaves Early Access. If you have to pay 20 bucks I would wait a couple more weeks to see if anything has improved unless you want it that badly. Great game 9.5/10 Would play again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Graphically, it's a huge stup up from the original. The graphics are very comparable to the Xbox 360 version of Bioshock Infinite. The weapon handling is pretty smooth, cameras seem to work better, and the AI is pretty good, although I think the AI could be harder. Also, you can see your legs, which is nice.


It's still in alpha but if you have $15 laying around, pick it up on sale. The atmosphere and core concept are unique, and the Art Deco designed ships are easy on the eyes and fun to play on.


What Blazing Griffin can improve on or add besides what they're already wokring on:
-more difficult AI, whether it be raising their movement speed, accuracy, ability to avoid cameras, whatever, just make them better at finding and eliminating their targets, even if the target is you or me.
-always room for more weapons
-maybe a 'hardcore' mode limited to the smaller maps where you have no hud and no hint as to where your quarry is.
-ability to drop bundles of money, say $500 or $1000 to bait players into going into dangerous zones
-do a free weekend to drum up business and build playerbase
-4 pack with bundle pricing, or raise the price to $25-$30 but do like the old game did and get a gift to give to a friend so they can play too, this way you'd sell more copies, albeit at a discount, via bundling. The minimum order would be 2 copies but the effective price per copy would remain at $12-$15.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI haven't played too much of this game, but from what I can tell so far, it is a great remake of the original The Ship: Murder Party. The game of course has some flaws, being in early access is all. I feel like there is a lack of certain weapons that add to the fun and variety of the original game. I know, however, that they are still adding in new weapons, so it is likely that this review itself will be dated within a few weeks. But onto the point once again, if you're a fan of the old The Ship, then it might be worth it just to buy this new game for the updated graphics and engine. And if maybe you needed a little something more from the original The Ship, then this game might interest you too, as there are plenty of seperate game modes being made. The game had a 15% discount at launch, and if you own The Ship: Murder Party, then another 25% stacks on, making the game 40% off at time of purchase, so it's definitely worth the purchase.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Played around with this game for a bit, and it looks great so far for 0.6 Alpha!

*Edit* Made a short video of this game
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F4Qyj4EQLHU

The memorable dances and music are STILL there :D
The original character designs and weapons are still there as well, but more updated visuals.
A new inventory feature that helps you organize your things a lot better than the last game, meaning if you pick up a lot of stuff, this game will automatically place your first four weapons you picked up in the first row, fixed to be the 1-4 hotkey section .
Lastly, they got rid of that annoying sprint feature from the first game.  No more crawling and stuff to reach your target! But... keep a look out for your need to sleep, as you will be sleeping a lot if you keep running around.

Speaking of visuals, I only put the settings on high (aka beautiful imo) and everything there looked fantastic. I was a little concerned trying it out on the highest quality, because I had some FPS issues entering certain parts of the map, going from 60 down to 25-30.

And I ran into some kind of sprint bug, where if you keep holding shift, your character will say they need sleep, but will not stop sprinting till they pass out on the spot.

But, so far so good!  Can't wait to see more of this game's content real soon!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As I'm writing this review, I've only played 10 minutes of The Ship: Remasted, and I can tell you now, with strong intentions, that this game is a masterpiece.

Stunning graphics, great atmosphere, 3 seconds into a game I'm already bursting with nostalgia as I hear that main menu theme song.

I load up a game of Deathmatch on my all-time favourite map - Krassin.

I spawn in and open up a cupboard straight away, to find a find a classic weapon - an old friend, if you wil; my beautiful repeater rifle.
Now I'm loaded and ready to go.
I enter a corridor where I find people ruthlessly hacking and slicing at each other, but I take a moment to survey the area. This game is beautiful.
I take 2 minutes out of my time to say hello to all the NPC's around the map and visit Boris - the security guard.
I purposely show him my weapons to get into jail (bet you've never heard anyone say that before) and I'm astonished by what I've seen.
The jail feels depressing, and makes you want to get out of there immediately, as a jail would, and this is a great way to teach you to hide your weapons (and/or cannabis) when sneaking around guards or cameras.

As of now, that's all I have to say, but I urge you, I urge you deeply, to buy this wonderfully exciting and weird (in a good way) game.

WHAAAAAAAAP WHAAAAAAAAAP!" - The Ship: Remasted

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's The Ship, but Remasted. I mean, there's not a lot more to say. For those who eat trash for a living and snorted too much cardboard dust to know what The Ship is, it was one of the funnest multiplayer experiences around, in which instead of focusing on any sort of generic deathmatch mode the game was based around hunting and killing one other player on the boat while avoiding your own hunter, with a variety of weapons that are worth different values of money. If that sounds more familiar then it's only natural because you probably recognize it as the Assassin's Creed multiplayer, because after commissioning the Ship developers to develop an awful XBOX Live Arcade spinoff called Bloody Good Time, Ubisoft quickly sprung on the opportunity to let Outerlight go out of business right before the game's release, nab the profits, and promptly steal their idea for use in their recycling-friendly assassin franchise.

But aside from all that, it is worth noting that the game is in very early access. It's lacking a fair amount of maps, and the online multiplayer isn't fully functional just yet. But the developers are showing promising work on it, so it will at the very least be worth buying fairly soon. If you have a group of friends and someone who can host a server the original The Ship still works fine, but if you're looking for a game that you can just pick up and join a server then Remasted is the way to do it.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

I was in the closed beta for this game before it was released onto Steam, and I've left it a good many months before making sure I leave a review to keep things fair. So far, the game is in Early Access - so you MUST definitely, absolutely, clearly understand that the game is going to have bugs at this time. Too many people seem to misunderstand this with many games that are in Early Access.

But onto my review - as a huge fan of The Ship ever since the first free HL1 mod, it's been fantastic to see how well the game has been developed throughout the years with all the new changes, new gamemodes, and now - a whole new engine! Whilst the game has had its ownership transferred through multiple companies (along with some developers joining said transfer) the game still has its incredible style you would come to expect from the game's series.

At the game's current state, it's mostly just eye-candy. It's playable, that's for sure - but it's still going to have the odd bug here and there that could possibly be game-breaking, but that's the fun in Early Access (which, again, a lot of people seem to misunderstand). I don't recommend this if you don't want to help with its developerment, but I definitely recommend it if your most interest is to be a part of a developing game and possibly have your idea/help introduced in a game!

Overall, an extremely beautiful game and really nice to be a part of, albeit not necessarily playable just yet, but still really fun to play when you manage to find the people and/or don't mind the occasional bug!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If the mix of Clue, The Sims and Saw (Yes, Saw) in the form of a hilarious and high tense party game intrigues you, The Ship is definitely for you.

Trapped on an oldschool cruise ship, you and everyone else is given a target - some other passenger onboard to kill... before someone else kills you.

The reward? Your life.
The tools? Whatever you can get your hands on (Bonus points for flair and creativity)
The obstacles? You have to get away with it without any witnesses. Get caught and you'll be put into a timeout... vulnerable in a prison cell.

So Remasted - Why buy this if you already own the original? Simply because you deserve to play this game looking its very best. The original dates back to the old Source days - And Remasted is nothing short of gorgeous.

Set sail for fail! ... but in a good way!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Since I'm one of the first persons to review The Ship: Remasted, let's make it something worth reading!
Even though I haven't played this version of the ship much (AMD video cards don't seem to run this well) i have seen enough to judge. I played the original ship (not on this account) and found it a very enjoyable game, that, however does not make this 'version' of the game automatically worth buying. I wouldn't buy it at this time if you already own the ship, but it is definitely worth considering after a couple weeks when development has progressed further and the playerbase has grown.

Pros:
- Nice graphics (on nvidia cards and possibly other AMD cards)
- Dedicated developers (Fast communication and ofcourse a free copy of the game)

Cons:
- Doesn't run well on my video card (AMD), neither does it on the other Amd cards i tried.
- Price (20$/15$ is imo way too much for people to pay that were late for the alpha but are still helping by buying it in early access)

I'd give this a solid 5/7 (overused?)
or
7,142857142857143/10

Have a nice launch day!

Things will be changed in the future since this remake is not done, so ignore any reviews complaining that the game isn't done yet.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review, if you want a full review, then please read better reviews then mine
PLEASE NOTE: This review is/was written when this game was in/is still in Early Access. Think twice before buying/playing this game

ALSO NOTE: I recommended this game with some exceptions, overall if the game did not live up to just a tiny expectation, I would not have recommended it at all, so please read the review carefully if you are thinking of buying/playing this game

ALSO, ALSO NOTE: The Ship: Remasted and The Ship: Murder Party have mostly the same review, that is because they mostly are the same game just The Ship: Remasted has had a visual upgrade to The Ship: Murder Party. Please think about this before commenting!
If you love going on cruises then this cruise is not for you. It is going to get dangerous and bloody...

The Ship: Murder Party is a game I have been playing since its inception and now the wonderful people at Blazing Griffin are making a visual upgrade to The Ship to continue it's fantastic lifespan into the near future!

The Ship's objective is that you are a passenger on a cruise ship owned by Mr. X, your objective is to kill a random passenger you have been assigned to but a hunter is hunting you down too. Its a simple game but can be really fun to play alone or with your friends

The Ship: Murder Party has always been by my heart and I appreciate that a company like Blazing Griffin has taken the rights from the now defunct Outerlight and continued to perfect the game

The big choice is whether you should get it or not. In it's current state I'd say no don't get it. It's unfinished, doesn't have all the mechanics The Ship had and is constantly being updated. I hate buying early access games and this is why, thankfully The Ship: Remasted was given to me for free by the developers because I was one of the lucky owners to get a copy

It is getting a recommended for those people, like me, who enjoyed The Ship so much and want to try it out but for others, I'd say, wait for it to get a few more updates then try or get it once it's finally finished

But, its one hell of a bloody good time!

RECOMMENDED :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

https://youtu.be/-US65zhVnFw
Game: The Ship: Remasted
Genre: Multiplayer FPS
Developer: Blazing Griffin
Publisher: Blazing Griffin
Copy supplied by developer

The Ship: Remasted is a remastered version of 2006's multiplayer Source engine game The Ship[/b], developed and published by Blazing Griffin. The game is currently available on Early Access, and it can be played either offline with 15 bots, online with 3 other players, or on LAN with 15 other players.

The game is exactly the same one as the original: you have a target to kill, while someone is trying to hunt you down as well, all while trying to fullfill your needs like going to the toilet, sleeping and eating. There are only 5 maps available right now, and more are being added through time.
The only real difference are the graphics: the game uses the Unity engine, and it does look stunning, with lots of new props and effects in every map. However, the performance is really bad, getting around 30fps on the Fastest settings.

Overall, if you own the original game, I recommend you stick with it until this one doesn't come out of Early Access, otherwise I think you might want to give this a try: it's a fun multiplayer game that never gets old.

Story: n/a
Graphics: 7.5
Gameplay: 8.5
Challenge: 7
Sound: 8
Replayability: 9

ENJOYMENT: 7.5
FRUSTRATION: 5

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I would love to say that this is just as awesome as the original, if not more so. But, on my Alienware laptop, with all hardware better than the listed required hardware, with graphics not even at it's best, I struggle to get even 15fps at any good time. Maybe there is something I could do to get it to run better, and advice would be greatly welcomed, but from what I have been able to do, I haven't been able to play the game for any decent amount of time. Hopefully, optimization patches in the future may help. It's just disappointing having a laptop that can run Shadow of Mordor and World of Warcraft on decent graphics, but not even get 15fps on a game much smaller than both listed games

From what I am reading from other people's reviews, I would still recommend the game

reviewText:
Early Access Review

To start with, I have played the original game. And I REALLY loved it, as it was very funny and interesting playing with friends. It is kind of a poker with elements of an action game. Unfortunately, official servers closed and only accessible were some servers from the internet, having a few players left, so game was becoming awfully empty.

I was glad to see the remake of the game I like and hoped this game to return, so me and couple of my friends bought it. To our disappointment, servers were so buggy, that one was hardly able to kill host, then game started to throw out players one by one and then my game crashed (I was a host).
Although, graphics look good, this game version is very poor with interative objects (doors do not open, when previously there were even secret paths!) to compare with older one.
In addition, character CONSTANTLY wants to sleep - running for like 20 seconds would fill the sleeping line and your char will fall asleep.

I realize this game being in early access and it is your choice to support developing this game, BUT I assume:
When released this game then won't be having any defferences from the old one except graphics, which are not critical.

So I ask for refund now and go play old version. Thank you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As much as I enjoy the original version of The Ship, I can't recommend this new version since it's not finished.

It's buggy and missing features. Nothing new added.
Oh and it seems like you need an average to upper-average PC to run with the graphics they show.

The only reason I would recommend this game is if it was exactly the same as the original game (which is not, because it's not finished, it's being re-done), and if people were playing all the time. (Servers were dead in the original version, and in this new version the servers are also dead).

Just buy it if you have friends to play in the same LAN.
But wait for a sale, because it's overpriced in my opinion.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

When I saw this game, I thought it would be an improved version of the engine the previous game had. I hoped to be able to use the maps and models in Source Filmmaker after playing some games. But alas, the devs switched over to *shudders* Unity, instead of sticking with the Source Engine again... I would've been more satisfied if the game had at least been made in Source, but it wasn't.

Also, while it seems that it might be good when all is said and done, I still prefer the original game more. Don't waste your money just yet until it's a bit more fleshed out.

Gameplay is okay, but it is a bit boring at the moment. Will be changing my review sometime in the future.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I may update this at a later date. This is one of the games where I really wish there was a 'maybe' button. I've played The Ship: Murder Party and that was really fun, but at the moment the Remastered or 'Remasted' ,as BlazingGriffin have named it, is quite buggy. Of course, such bugs and limitations are to be expected as the game is still in Alpha. Seriously, I WANT the game to work out so I can murder my friends , then come home, relax and play The Ship: Remasted, but the game doesn't feel finished AT THE MOMENT. For example, if you hate the maps Andrea Doria, Atlanta, Batavier and Krassin, you're not going to have a very fun Alpha. Plus, I lag in the game quite a bit, even on the lowest graphic settings. My computer is an old piece of crap these days, but it can still run most games pretty smoothly with the graphics still looking good. Hell, there was no lag when I was killing zombies in The Walking Dead (go buy that game, too. WARNING: review may contain product placement) but when I'm wandering around a ship following people and slowly hitting them with some weapon, I get lag.

This game is about murdering people on a ship

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is a great attempt at recreating a legendary game. But this should not cost money. The gaming experience is horrible - and I am not talking about the bugs. The whole gameplay is altered in a bad way. If you want to play The Ship, download the old version. At least that one has decent LAN. PS: Was there even a multiplayer mode in the remastered version, 'cus I certainly didn't manage to play online.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis feels so different. I walked into this thinking it'd be one all redone. We're better off saying The Ship 2 instead of The Ship Remastered. Baring all bugs, the game is decent, but it fails to even capture the atmosphere one had, in my opinion.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've seen many of the reviews, and I agree with 95% of them. However, though my computer matches the specs mentioned, the game is VERY laggy for me. It's a good start, but at the moment your best bet is to stick with The Ship (not remasted). Some pros and cons:

Pros:
-Excellent graphics
-Bots act less like bots (more intelligent movements)
-Easier multiplayer (though I would not reccomend multiplayer at the moment)
-Developers seem eager to satisfy the gamers, so I feel the game will improve.

Cons:
-Characters (bartender, bellboy, etc) look creepy (very very VERY blue eyes)
-Graphics too good (as mentioned above, lags for me)
-FOV seems bigger, so it takes getting used to
-Mouse sensitivity makes FOV seem even bigger than it is, so it takes getting used to
-Elevators are broken. Literally. It says out of service.
-Ships like Andrea Doria seem abandoned. It's a lot darker and the pool and elevators are Out of Service". The Ship (not remasted) seemed more alive
date: kind of like the roaring 20's. I just don't think they represent the same time period.\n\nOverall
recommended: I think it's a good start. But I don't think it's worth the money and I don't think it's quite ready. As I mentioned above
hoursPlayed: the developers seem eager to improve the game
voteText: but for 19.99

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Unfortunately, this game doesn't have any connection to space.

DISADVANTAGES:

- Sun doesn't look very realistic.

- There is no Nibiru or Planet X next to our sun in this game.

- Bad physics.

- Stars are not alligned properly.

- This game doesn't have ANY connection to space at all...

ADVANTAGES:

- Sky and sun.

Thank you for your attention and be aware of upcoming Planet X.
